On Fri, 17 Jan 2003 steffen.gemkow@... wrote:

> I believe the core idea of "test before code" is possible with
> _regenerating_ tools like JUnitDoclet. It just requires some self
> control.

Without getting into what is "real" test-before-code and what isn't, I
have no use (when writing new code) for tools that generate test cases
from code. I always write the test first, because the test is where I
start to work out how the interface of my new class will look. Often I
found, before I started doing this, I'd write the interface (leaving
the methods unimplemented), write the test, and then discover that the
interface I thought I wanted isn't really the one I wanted after all,
once I try to use it.

cjs
